Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2011 08:48PM lisaemma wrote: I was actually told to eat caloric foods during radiation so that it would help keep up my energy and fight fatigue.  Only two weeks left and I feel great.  I know the fatigue might be coming, but so far so good!
Posts.Title: Radiation and Weight Loss mary7 gb2115

Posts.Content: lisaemma wrote: Hi Ladies, I know we pretty much all experience skin changes with radiation, and I certainly don't feel I have anything to complain about.  It's over; thank god - I finished two weeks ago.  Apart from the burn felt on my nipple, I'd have to say there was little discomfort.  But that brings me to my question... The burned skin around my nipple and areola 'shed' a couple weeks ago.  I have a nice new layer of pink skin on my nipple, but what remains is a thin ring of the darker/burned skin around the very outside ring of  my areola.  That one area doesn't seem to want to peel.   In the scheme of things, this is probably no big deal...but how long before this also peels?  It's a bit freaky looking~ Am I stuck with this? Lisa Lisa Dx 6/10/2011, DCIS, <1cm, Stage IA, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Ring around the nipple (i.e. when will this burned skin shed?) lisaemma lisaemma
